title: Interim govt to stop Awami rally
Awami student wing chief says working to restore democracy
content: Forced into hiding after their organization was banned by Bangladesh's interim government, the president of the Chhatra League told TOI that they are using social media to regroup and plan their next moves to restore democracy in the country.  He added that over a lakh students are being prevented from continuing their education.
summary: Forced into hiding after their organization was banned by Bangladesh's interim government, the president of the Chhatra League told TOI that they are using social media to regroup and plan their next moves to restore democracy in the country.  He added that over a lakh students are being prevented from continuing their education.

title: North Korean GPS manipulation disrupted dozens of planes and vessels, South Korea says
content: North Korea disrupted GPS signals near its western border for a second day, impacting flights and ships. This follows a pattern of escalating tensions, with North Korea engaging in electronic warfare and propaganda campaigns against South Korea, raising concerns about aviation safety and regional stability.
summary: North Korea disrupted GPS signals near its western border for a second day, impacting flights and ships. This follows a pattern of escalating tensions, with North Korea engaging in electronic warfare and propaganda campaigns against South Korea, raising concerns about aviation safety and regional stability.

title: American tourist on vacation found dead in Hungary; suspect arrested
content: An American tourist, Mackenzie Michalski, was tragically found dead in Hungary after being reported missing. The suspect, an Irish citizen she met at a nightclub, confessed to killing her during an "intimate encounter" and attempting to conceal the crime.
summary: An American tourist, Mackenzie Michalski, was tragically found dead in Hungary after being reported missing. The suspect, an Irish citizen she met at a nightclub, confessed to killing her during an "intimate encounter" and attempting to conceal the crime.

title: China, Indonesia cos set to ink $10bn deals
5 siblings, some deaf, among dead in Israeli hits in Lebanon
Qatar cannot continue Gaza talks, warns Hamas over Doha office: Source
Famine looming in north Gaza: UN-backed report
content: Famine is looming in the northern Gaza Strip amid increased hostilities and a near-halt in food aid, a UN-backed assessment said Saturday. The alert from the Famine Review Committee warned of "an imminent and substantial likelihood of famine occurring, due to the rapidly deteriorating situation in the Gaza Strip."
summary: Famine is looming in the northern Gaza Strip amid increased hostilities and a near-halt in food aid, a UN-backed assessment said Saturday.  The alert from the Famine Review Committee warned of "an imminent and substantial likelihood of famine occurring, due to the rapidly deteriorating situation in the Gaza Strip."

title: Maersk ship denied docking at Spanish port over Israel arms
Over 130 homes lost in Calif wildfire; rare brushfire in NY
content: Firefighters in California are making progress against a massive wildfire that has destroyed over 100 homes near Los Angeles, as calmer weather conditions provide some relief. Meanwhile, New York City battled a rare brushfire in Brooklyn's Prospect Park, fueled by dry conditions and high temperatures that have sparked numerous blazes across the northeastern United States.
summary: Firefighters in California are making progress against a massive wildfire that has destroyed over 100 homes near Los Angeles, as calmer weather conditions provide some relief. Meanwhile, New York City battled a rare brushfire in Brooklyn's Prospect Park, fueled by dry conditions and high temperatures that have sparked numerous blazes across the northeastern United States.

title: Iran to Trump: Change policy of 'max pressure'
Trump adviser: Priority in Ukraine is peace, not return of lost territory
content: A top aide to President-elect Donald Trump revealed the new administration's focus in Ukraine will be on achieving peace, not reclaiming lost territories like Crimea. Bryan Lanza emphasized the need for Ukraine to present a "realistic vision for peace," suggesting that demanding Crimea's return would be a non-starter. While Ukraine insists on the return of all captured territory, Russia signaled openness to Trump's peace proposals amidst ongoing conflict.
summary: A top aide to President-elect Donald Trump revealed the new administration's focus in Ukraine will be on achieving peace, not reclaiming lost territories like Crimea.  Bryan Lanza emphasized the need for Ukraine to present a "realistic vision for peace," suggesting that demanding Crimea's return would be a non-starter. While Ukraine insists on the return of all captured territory, Russia signaled openness to Trump's peace proposals amidst ongoing conflict.

title: Afghanistan to attend UN climate summit for first time since Taliban takeover
content: For the first time since the Taliban took control, an Afghan delegation will be present at the UN climate summit in Azerbaijan. Despite not being officially recognized by any nation, the Taliban emphasize that their political isolation shouldn't hinder their involvement in crucial climate discussions.
summary: For the first time since the Taliban took control, an Afghan delegation will be present at the UN climate summit in Azerbaijan. Despite not being officially recognized by any nation, the Taliban emphasize that their political isolation shouldn't hinder their involvement in crucial climate discussions.

title: Kate Middleton joins royals at Remembrance Day event after cancer recovery
content: Princess Kate Middleton, recently having completed chemotherapy for an undisclosed illness, made a poignant appearance at the Festival of Remembrance in London. The event, honoring fallen soldiers, saw the Princess in black attire adorned with a symbolic red poppy.
summary: Princess Kate Middleton, recently having completed chemotherapy for an undisclosed illness, made a poignant appearance at the Festival of Remembrance in London. The event, honoring fallen soldiers, saw the Princess in black attire adorned with a symbolic red poppy.

title: US couple stab and shoot each other to death while 11-year-old son plays video games
content: In a horrifying incident on Halloween, a married couple in Washington State was found dead in their kitchen after a violent altercation. Their 11-year-old son, unaware of the tragedy due to wearing earbuds, discovered their bodies and alerted authorities.
summary: In a horrifying incident on Halloween, a married couple in Washington State was found dead in their kitchen after a violent altercation. Their 11-year-old son, unaware of the tragedy due to wearing earbuds, discovered their bodies and alerted authorities.

title: America 'didn't like' her: Bill Maher on Harris' presidential loss
content: On his show "Real Time," Bill Maher challenged journalists' explanations for Kamala Harris's presidential loss to Donald Trump. He dismissed claims that Harris lacked time to connect with voters, arguing that Americans found her unfavorable. Maher criticized attempts to attribute her defeat to sexism or racism, asserting that the public simply wasn't impressed with her campaign.
summary: On his show "Real Time," Bill Maher challenged journalists' explanations for Kamala Harris's presidential loss to Donald Trump. He dismissed claims that Harris lacked time to connect with voters, arguing that Americans found her unfavorable. Maher criticized attempts to attribute her defeat to sexism or racism, asserting that the public simply wasn't impressed with her campaign.

title: UK government scrambles to repair damage to UK-US special relationship caused by Labour supporting Harris and tweets attacking Trump
content: The UK government is navigating a diplomatic challenge as past criticisms of US President-elect Donald Trump by Labour Party members resurface. Trump's lawyers have called for an investigation into potential foreign interference related to Labour staff campaigning for Kamala Harris. Despite previous strong criticisms, Labour figures, including Keir Starmer and David Lammy, have reached out to Trump and emphasized the importance of the US-UK relationship.
summary: The UK government is navigating a diplomatic challenge as past criticisms of US President-elect Donald Trump by Labour Party members resurface. Trump's lawyers have called for an investigation into potential foreign interference related to Labour staff campaigning for Kamala Harris. Despite previous strong criticisms, Labour figures, including Keir Starmer and David Lammy, have reached out to Trump and emphasized the importance of the US-UK relationship.

title: No 10 Diwali party serves alcohol and meat, leaves British Indians repulsed
content: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer's Diwali celebration at No. 10 Downing Street sparked controversy among British Indians. The inclusion of meat and alcohol in the menu drew criticism and was deemed disrespectful to the religious significance of the festival. Hindu groups expressed disappointment and urged for cultural sensitivity in future events.
summary: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer's Diwali celebration at No. 10 Downing Street sparked controversy among British Indians. The inclusion of meat and alcohol in the menu drew criticism and was deemed disrespectful to the religious significance of the festival. Hindu groups expressed disappointment and urged for cultural sensitivity in future events.

title: Oprah Winfrey reportedly charged $1 million for hosting Harris' interview and campaign event
content: Kamala Harris' presidential campaign invested heavily in media appearances, including a $1 million payment to Oprah Winfrey for a rally and interview. Despite significant spending on events and podcasts, some critics argue these efforts failed to resonate with voters or distance Harris from the then-current administration.
summary: Kamala Harris' presidential campaign invested heavily in media appearances, including a $1 million payment to Oprah Winfrey for a rally and interview. Despite significant spending on events and podcasts, some critics argue these efforts failed to resonate with voters or distance Harris from the then-current administration.

title: No sex, no marriage: Women protest Trump’s win by boycotting relationships with men
content: Inspired by South Korea's "4B" movement, some American women are boycotting relationships with men and abstaining from sex in protest of Donald Trump's presidential victory. They cite concerns about reproductive rights and the rise in young male Republican voters as their reasons for participating in the movement.
summary: Inspired by South Korea's "4B" movement, some American women are boycotting relationships with men and abstaining from sex in protest of Donald Trump's presidential victory. They cite concerns about reproductive rights and the rise in young male Republican voters as their reasons for participating in the movement.
